FEATURED PROJECTS

A glance at my most recent projects
Click on the following videos to learn more

Recycler Baxter
Using computer vision and motion planning to make Baxter sort cans and bottles for recycling
Real-Time Objects Recognition
Building and training a deep neural network to recognize and classify traffic-signs and recyclable trash
EKF SLAM from Scratch
Implementing feature-based EKF SLAM with unsupervised learning from Scratch
Mobile Manipulation
Applying feedback control to make a mobile manipulator to pick up a block at a specified location and carry it to desired location
Robotic Arm Control Using Computer Vision Perception
Programming robotic arm to identify and "steal" a pen using 3D camera and image recognition
Maze Implementation and Exploration
Generating, solving and visualizing a maze
Turtlebot3 SLAM
Exploration and navigation using SLAM Toolbox
Jack-in-a-Box Dynamic Simulation
Simulating the dynamics of a Jack-in-a-Box system
Robot Navigation and Control
Building a wheeled robot and programming it to navigate autonomously through an obstacle course

ABOUT ME


I am a master’s student at Northwestern University’s Robotics program (MSR), graduating in the fall of 2021.

I started my professional journey by gaining valuable hands-on experience as an electrical technician and technical program manager in the Israeli Defense Forces and later as a mechanical engineer in both enterprise and defense technology applications.

Looking forward, I wish to continue growing and challenging myself by joining the emerging world of robotics.
I am especially interested in robotics manipulation, autonomous mobile robots, controls, planning, perception, and SLAM, and looking for job opportunities in related areas.




If you have any questions or opportunities, please feel free to contact me using the information below.



Contact Me
